Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2010 09:02PM 1RockerMom wrote: People can be so insinsitive.  Let me give you a much needed laugh.  I work at a credi union and this one old man with absolutly no manners(or teeth for that matter) was constantly commenting on my hair..(this was a year ago when  I was going through chemo and had no hair.) One day it was " it's a different color"(I wore a couple of different wigs and cut one short ) the next day another comment... well I was sick of them. Anyway one day he said to the other teller "boy the next time I come in here shes going  to be bald.")  Well that was it.  I looked at my co workers(they even ran in the other room to grab my manager as they knew what I was going to do. ) Then I grabbed my wig and pulled it off. And there I was in all my glory bald as a baby!!!! I'm here to tell you he was absolutly speechless!!!! He couldnt think of a darn thing to say and  my co workers, I about had to pick them up off the floor they were laughing so hard. So hang in there . Your hair will grow back soon enough.  My hair looks great now,and that member, he never says one Word about my hair anymore!!! and you know what? I'm serious, if I had to do all over again I would always go bald!!!!
Posts.Title: THAT STUNG.................. jenn3 jenn3

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2010 10:03AM 1RockerMom wrote: Congrats on your baby...so happy for all of you!!  And You look beautifull !!!
Posts.Title: Pics of Baby Kilian Pure Meece

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2009 07:34PM 1RockerMom wrote: After reading all the posts I have to tell my storey.  I had a double mastectomy in September and was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer.  My tumor was also on the left breast. My best friend from North Carolina flew out to be with me for a couple of weeks.  We went to meet with my radioligist and he was very knowledgable and had a great sense of humor.  He did however tell me about every possible side effect.  He told me its just  something they have to do.  Well by the time he was done listing everything...possible heart problems,lung problems,lymphodema etc...my girlfriend turned to me and said"Boy having your breasts removed doesnt seem like anything compared to all that...Im still getting chemo now halfway done today.. Yeah !but still have the rads to look forward to.Ugh!  But  I just keep my faith and my positive attitude and go with the flow. Remember we didnt ask for this disease it was just thrown into our lives and we just  have to take it one day at a time...Look at it this way you have come this far...you will befine...Lots of hugs Teresa...
